title: Everton in talks to snap-up 15-year-old Nottingham Forest starlet Brennan Johnson
text:
Everton in talks to snap-up 15-year-old Nottingham Forest starlet Brennan Johnson 
Ronald Koeman and new director of football Steve Walsh eyeing England's best young talent Gossip Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments Everton look to be in talks with Nottingham Forest starlet Brennan Johnson, with the Toffees keen to bring in the country’s most talented youth. 
The 15-year-old has impressed for Forest’s U18 side, leading to Everton seeing a number of bids for Johnson rejected over the course of the season. Getty Images Everton director of football Steve Walsh has overseen a development of young English talent since his arrival last year PA:Press Association 6 The Toffees are currently undergoing a change in approach in the transfer market, focusing on their academy and young purchases 
According to the Telegraph , the club are still confident of landing the Forest academy product, with reports suggesting £1m will be enough to lure him to Goodison Park. 
Keep up to date with ALL the EVERTON news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Everton director of football Steve Walsh is expecting to begin negotiations with the England U16 international, who has revamped the club’s youth system since his appointment last year. Getty Images Walsh is hoping to land Johnson for £1m from Forest in time for the summer Getty Images 6 Walsh has been an integral part of the early success manager Ronald Koeman has overseen at the club 
Under boss Ronald Koeman , the Goodison faithful have seen the likes of 18-year-old academy product Tom Davies and 19-year-old former Charlton star Admeola Lookman break into the first team. 
Speaking about Everton’s developing vision of bringing young talent through the club, Walsh said: “The most important thing is the recruitment of players for the first team, but I’m also conscious of the fact we have a good academy and good young players coming through. Getty Images Tom Davies and Admeola Lookman have forced their way into the first team and made a real impact Getty Images 6 Koeman has embraced the culture of young players at Everton, giving Davies a lot of game time already this season 
“Doing that is the hallmark of a successful club. We will build on what we’ve got and take the club forward.” 
Johnson isn’t the only Forest starlet to be catching the eyes of Premier League heavyweights, with the likes of Ben Brereton, Joe Worrall and Arvin Appiah all reportedly being scouted. Everton forward Romelu Lukaku sets new goal scoring record for Everton
